scrape.title: The dinner
scrape.author: Shelley Leveridge
scrape.text:
If this is what Gone Girl was like, I'm glad I never read that one. I really didn't enjoy this book. There is nothing redeemable about any of the characters. They're all incredibly self-centered, self-serving, and narcissistic. Never mind the repeated statements by the main character of leaving out details of the story because "...it's nobody's business."
I finished it, but under internal protest. I'd already given up on two books this year and couldn't give myself an out on this one.
